criteria: Evaluation and Accordance with Textual Evidence
descriptions: Fails to identify any explanations for actions or events.
Identifies only one explanation without textual support.
Identifies multiple explanations but struggles to connect them to the text.
Identifies several explanations and attempts to link them to the text, but analysis is superficial.
Clearly identifies multiple explanations and effectively connects them to textual evidence.
Masterfully identifies various explanations, providing insightful connections to textual evidence.
Does not attempt to evaluate explanations or relate them to the text.
Attempts to evaluate explanations but does not use textual evidence.
Evaluates explanations with limited reference to the text.
Evaluates explanations using some textual evidence, but the connection is not always clear.
Clearly evaluates explanations and supports judgments with relevant textual evidence.
Insightfully evaluates explanations, expertly using textual evidence to support judgments and showing a nuanced understanding.
Does not acknowledge any uncertainty in the text.
Vaguely acknowledges uncertainty without specific examples.
Acknowledges uncertainty but does not explain its significance.
Acknowledges uncertainty and provides a basic explanation of its significance.
Clearly acknowledges uncertainty and explains its significance with textual support.
Insightfully acknowledges uncertainty, thoroughly explains its significance, and demonstrates a deep understanding of textual nuances.
